div.a: Click Here for Nevada R-V Resources for Learners

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Nevada R-V School District is closely monitoring the impacts and updates related to COVID-19.

h3.div: GOVERNOR PARSON HAS ORDERED ALL PUBLIC SCHOOLS WILL REMAIN CLOSED THROUGHOUT THE REMAINDER OF THE 2019-2020 ACADEMIC YEAR. THIS CLOSURE IMPACTS ALL EXTRA AND CO-CURRICULAR ACTIVITIES, EVENTS, PRACTICES AND BEFORE OR AFTER SCHOOL PROGRAMS. ALL BUILDINGS REMAIN CLOSED TO THE PUBLIC AND NONESSENTIAL PERSONNEL. NEVADA R-V WILL CONTINUE TO PROVIDE MEAL OPTIONS FOR CHILDREN UNDER THE AGE OF 18. ADDITIONAL INFORMATION WILL BE PROVIDED AFTER THE STAY AT HOME ORDER FOR OUR AREA HAS BEEN LIFTED.

ul.li: 3.18.2020 Our free grab and go lunches will now include breakfast for the next day. Pickup times and locations will remain the same.

li.a: Workplace, School and Home Guidance from the CDC 3.10.2020

div.p: We are a community of learners who believe in the limitless possibilities of education through...
...where minutes matter and every day counts!

div.a: Influenza Parent Letter and Signs/Symptoms Information

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: To mutually experience the thoughts, emotions and direct experience of others

The Vernon County Youth Task Force (VCYTF) Character Champion program is an opportunity for the community to work together to develop a culture of character for our youth. Character words are presented each quarter through the united efforts of individuals, businesses, schools, civic organizations, the media, and the faith community. YOU are invited to JOIN the Character Champion team in any way you would like to help!

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc
hJDwNd-AhqUyc-c5RTEf purZT-AhqUyc-c5RTEf pSzOP-AhqUyc-c5RTEf jXK9ad D2fZ2 wHaque GNzUNc

div.p: Senate Bill 368 required the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education to create a website about the trauma-informed schools initiative that includes information for schools and parents. Further, the law requires that each school provide the address of the website, created by DESE, to "all parents of the students in its district." The address is: http://motraumaschools.com

div.class: hJDwNd-AhqUyc-uQSCkd jXK9ad D2fZ2 OjCsFc wHaque GNzUNc

div.small: This site contains link to outside sources. The Nevada R-V School District is not responsible for any content housed/published on those sites.
